required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of LY3053102 in Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Dose, Dose-Escalation Study to Determine the Safety, Tolerability, and Pharmacokinetics of LY3053102 in Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of the study drug known as LY3053102 in healthy participants. The study will also investigate how much of the study drug gets into the blood stream and how long it takes the body to get rid of it. Information about any side effects that may occur will also be collected. The study is expected to last approximately 8 weeks for each participant (up to 4 weeks from the screening visit to the administration of study drug and an additional 4 weeks of follow up).

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with One or More Adverse Events (AEs) or Any Serious AEs

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Curve (AUC) of LY3053102
Number of Participants Developing Anti-LY3053102 Antibodies

arm_group.description: Single escalating dose (2 mg up to 400 mg) of LY3053102 administered subcutaneously (SQ).
Single dose of placebo matching LY3053102 administered SQ.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Normal blood pressure
- Female participants are not of child-bearing potential due to surgical sterilization (hysterectomy or bilateral oophorectomy or tubal ligation) or menopause
- Have a body mass index (BMI) of 18.5 to 40.0 kilograms per square meter (kg/m^2), inclusive, at screening
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have known allergies to LY3053102 or related compounds
- Have a history of significant disease that may affect the actions of drugs or may pose a risk when taking the study medication
- Have a history of developing allergies, asthma, severe drug allergies (symptoms including, but not limited to, itching, red rashes, sores on the skin, scaling and shedding of skin), allergies or reactions to more than one drug, or have had bad reactions to skin creams containing corticosteroids
- Heavy smokers (more than 10 cigarettes a day)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.
